relation: I am a commuter, so am not involved in campus activities
Courses are designed to be challenging and to prepare students for all aspects of the intended career. The required reading is heavy to cover various perspectives.
If you ask a lot of questions, it will keep help you to be able to accomplish what is required and keep you from misunderstanding. The website is not always updated and can be confusing to navigate

The courses are very challenging intellectually. CSU Stanislaus has competitive graduate level classes. The campus is large with many trees and small ponds with fountains making it a beautiful campus.

textAfterTable: Bertha from Santa Ana, CA 01/16/2011 Reviewer is A current student here. 8 out of 8 people found this review useful. 2 of 82 Categories Comments Great for these types of students If you really want to just get out and want a new scene or if you want a peaceful small school its perfect. Tips for prospective students Come check out the campus see it you like it. Once you've decided to come here make sure to get involved on campus it opens so many doors. If you can I highly advise doing Student Leadership Program during the summer you'll meet so many new people. Also make sure you go to as many events at school because all the events we put together it's for the students and you're paying for it through ur student fees so get your moneys worth by going. Bang for the buck Since the school is very small it's as if your paying the price of a public school but the quality of a private school. The school
